11-14.question: What 'gift' from today can you trace back to God's providence rather than your own hard work?

verse.text: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God.

saint.text: Knowledge without love only puffeth up; but love edifieth.

11-15.question: Are you using your intelligence to serve others, or to make yourself feel superior?

verse.text: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom.

saint.text: A soul that loves God finds its peace even in the midst of trials.

11-16.question: Is your peace currently dependent on your circumstances, or on your union with Christ?

verse.text: Deal thy bread to the hungry, and bring the needy into thy house.

saint.text: We should use the things of this world as if we used them not.

11-17.question: If everything you owned was taken away today, would your identity in Christ remain unshaken?

verse.text: And the Lord make you to increase and abound in charity one towards another.

saint.text: Faith is the foundation of all that we do.

11-18.question: Has your charity 'increased' toward the person you find most difficult to be around?

verse.text: But follow the things that are of peace: and keep the things that are of edification.

saint.text: True nobility is found in the service of God.

11-19.question: Are your words today building up (edifying) those around you, or are they tearing them down?

verse.text: For the Lord is a sun and a shield: the Lord will give grace and glory.

saint.text: Humility is the only ladder that reaches to heaven.

11-20.question: In what way is God being a 'shield' for you today by closing a door that was dangerous for your soul?

verse.text: Hearken, O daughter, and see, and incline thy ear.

saint.text: Mary offered herself to God in the temple, and so should we.

11-21.question: How can you 'present' your daily work to God today as a holy offering?

verse.text: Sing ye to the Lord a new canticle: let his praise be in the church of the saints.

saint.text: To sing is to pray twice.

11-22.question: Is there a 'song of praise' in your heart today, or only a list of complaints?

verse.text: Behold, I stand at the gate, and knock. If any man shall hear my voice... I will come in to him.

saint.text: The soul's salvation is the only thing that matters.

11-23.question: Is there a specific 'gate' of your heart that you have kept locked because you fear Christ's light?

verse.text: He that followeth me, walketh not in darkness, but shall have the light of life.

saint.text: A martyr's blood is the seed of the Church.

11-24.question: Are you willing to 'suffer' small social inconveniences for the sake of the 'Light of Life'?

verse.text: For the Lord is just, and hath loved justice.

saint.text: Faith is the light that guides us through the darkness of this world.

11-25.question: Do you treat your coworkers and employees with the 'justice' that you would want from God?

verse.text: Trust in the Lord with all thy heart, and lean not upon thy own prudence.

saint.text: The more we give to God, the more He gives to us.

11-26.question: Where is your 'own prudence' causing you anxiety because you haven't yet trusted the Lord with the outcome?

verse.text: The eyes of the Lord are upon the just: and his ears unto their prayers.

saint.text: Mary is the source of all our hope.
saint.source: Our Lady of the Miraculous Medal

11-27.question: Do you pray with the confidence that God is actively 'listening' to you right now?

verse.text: Create a clean heart in me, O God.

saint.text: Patience is the only way to conquer the world.

11-28.question: What 'spiritual debris' has built up in your heart this month that needs to be cleared out?

verse.text: Be you also ready: for at what hour you think not, the Son of man will come.

saint.text: Let us always be prepared to meet the Lord.

11-29.question: If Christ came for your soul tonight, would you be 'ready' or would you be ashamed of how you spent today?

verse.text: Come ye after me, and I will make you to be fishers of men.

saint.text: To follow Christ is the only path to true joy.

11-30.question: As November ends, who in your life is waiting for you to 'cast a net' of faith and invite them to Christ?

verse.text: Drop down dew, ye heavens, from above, and let the clouds rain the just.

saint.text: Advent is a time of waiting for the Light to enter our darkness.

12-01.question: In the 'darkness' of your current struggles, are you looking for a worldly solution or for the 'Rain' of the Just One?

verse.text: The Lord is patient and full of mercy, taking away iniquity and wickedness.

saint.text: A soul that is at peace with God is a soul that is ready for anything.

12-02.question: Is your heart 'at peace' today, or are you letting the 'iniquity' of the world disturb your internal silence?

verse.text: Go ye into the whole world, and preach the gospel to every creature.

saint.text: What does it profit a man to gain the whole world and suffer the loss of his own soul?
saint.work: Letters to the Society of Jesus

12-03.question: Are you more concerned with 'gaining the world' (status and wealth) or with the health of your soul?

verse.text: Behold a virgin shall be with child, and bring forth a son, and they shall call his name Emmanuel.

saint.text: The Son of God became man so that we might become God.

12-04.question: Does the reality of 'God with us' (Emmanuel) change the way you face loneliness today?

verse.text: Wait on the Lord, act manfully: and let thy heart take courage.

saint.text: Prayer is the best preparation for the coming of the King.

12-05.question: Are you using this season to 'prepare' your heart, or are you just busy with the 'preparations' of the world?

verse.text: He that hath the substance of this world... and shall shut up his bowels from him: how doth the charity of God abide in him?

saint.text: The giver of every good gift is the Lord Himself.

12-06.question: When you give to others today, are you doing it to be seen, or to reflect the 'secret' generosity of God?

verse.text: For the Lord is a great God, and a great King above all gods.

saint.text: The Church is the ship in which we sail safely through the storms of life.

12-07.question: Is there a 'storm' in your life right now where you have forgotten that Christ is the Captain of the ship?

verse.text: Thou art all fair, O my love, and there is not a spot in thee.

saint.text: Mary is the most beautiful flower that has ever bloomed in the garden of God.

12-08.question: How can you honor the 'purity' of Mary today in your own thoughts and conversations?

verse.text: Blessed are the clean of heart: for they shall see God.

saint.text: Am I not here, who am your Mother? Are you not under my shadow and protection?
saint.source: St. Juan Diego (Words of Our Lady)

12-09.question: Do you feel 'under the shadow' of Mary's protection, or are you trying to solve your problems entirely on your own?

verse.text: The Lord is high, and looketh on the low.

saint.text: Our Lady of Loreto is the house where the Word became Flesh.

12-10.question: Is your home a place where the 'Word' can dwell, or is it filled with the noise of distraction?

verse.text: Behold the Lord shall come, and all his saints with him.

saint.text: The shepherd of the Church must be a defender of the faith.

12-11.question: Are you 'defending' your faith in your social circles, or are you hiding it to fit in?

verse.text: He hath not done in like manner to every nation: and his judgments he hath not made manifest to them.

saint.text: I am the Mother of the true God for Whom one lives.

12-12.question: Do you live as if you are truly 'living for God,' or are you just surviving for yourself?

verse.text: The light shineth in darkness, and the darkness did not comprehend it.

saint.text: To die for the faith is to find the true light.

12-13.question: Is there a 'darkness' in your life (envy, pride, or fear) that you have not yet allowed the Light of Christ to enter?

verse.text: For the word of God is living and effectual.

saint.text: In the evening of life, we will be judged on love alone.

12-14.question: If you were 'judged on love' today, would you be satisfied with the way you treated the people closest to you?

verse.text: The Lord is my shepherd: and I shall want nothing.

saint.text: Silence is the guardian of the spiritual life.

12-15.question: Can you find ten minutes of 'silence' today to simply listen for the Shepherd's voice?

verse.text: But the path of the just, as a shining light, goeth forwards.

saint.text: Every soul that loves is a soul that prays.

12-16.question: Is your prayer life 'going forwards,' or have you stopped growing in your relationship with God?

verse.text: O Wisdom, who camest out of the mouth of the Most High... come to teach us the way of prudence.

saint.text: The wisdom of the world is a heavy burden, but the wisdom of God is a light yoke.

12-17.question: Are you seeking 'prudence' (the right way to act) through prayer, or through the opinions of the world?

verse.text: And thou, Bethlehem Ephrata... out of thee shall he come forth unto me that is to be the ruler in Israel.

saint.text: Let us prepare the way of the Lord in our souls.

12-18.question: What ' Bethlehem'—small, humble, and overlooked—is God using to work a miracle in your life right now?

verse.text: Create a clean heart in me, O God.

saint.text: The heart of a Christian should be a dwelling place for God.

12-19.question: If Christ were to be born in your 'heart' tonight, would He find it 'clean' and ready for Him?

verse.text: Behold the handmaid of the Lord: be it done to me according to thy word.

saint.text: Mary's 'Yes' is the key that opened the door to our salvation.

12-20.question: In what specific area of your life is God waiting for your 'Yes'—your total surrender?

verse.text: For the Lord is just, and hath loved justice: his countenance hath beheld righteousness.

saint.text: Blessed is the one who believes in the promises of the Lord.

12-21.question: Do you 'believe' God's promises even when your current situation seems to contradict them?

verse.text: My soul doth magnify the Lord: And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.

saint.text: True joy is not found in things, but in the presence of God.

12-22.question: Is your soul 'magnifying' (making bigger) the goodness of God today, or the problems you are facing?

verse.text: Behold, I send my angel, and he shall prepare the way before my face.

saint.text: Silence is the language of God; all else is a poor translation.

12-23.question: Are you 'preparing the way' for Christ in your home, or are you too busy with the noise of the holidays?

verse.text: For this day is born to you a Saviour, who is Christ the Lord, in the city of David.

saint.text: Tonight, Heaven and Earth are joined in the Person of a Child.

12-24.question: As you stand at the threshold of Christmas, what is the one 'gift' of your heart you want to give to the Christ Child?

verse.text: And the Word was made flesh, and dwelt among us.

saint.text: Awake, O man! For your sake God became man.

12-25.question: How does the fact that 'God became man' change the way you see the dignity of every person you meet today?

verse.text: But he, being full of the Holy Ghost, looking up steadfastly to heaven, saw the glory of God.

saint.text: The first martyr is the seed of the Church's courage.

12-26.question: Are you 'looking up' toward Heaven when you are faced with criticism, or are you looking for an earthly defense?

verse.text: That which we have seen and have heard, we declare unto you.

saint.text: God is love, and he that abideth in love, abideth in God.

12-27.question: Is the 'love' you show others today a reflection of the 'Love' that is God?

verse.text: Out of the mouth of infants and of sucklings thou hast perfected praise.

saint.text: The innocent suffer, but their blood is not shed in vain.

12-28.question: How are you protecting the 'innocence' of your own soul and the souls of the children in your life?

verse.text: But follow the things that are of peace: and keep the things that are of edification.

saint.text: I die for the Name of Jesus and for the defense of the Church.

12-29.question: Are you 'edifying' your community, or are your words contributing to its division?

verse.text: The eyes of the Lord are upon the just: and his ears unto their prayers.

saint.text: Let us always be ready to serve the Lord with all our hearts.

12-30.question: As the year draws to a close, can you see how God's 'eyes' have been upon you through every trial?

verse.text: Be you also ready: for at what hour you think not, the Son of man will come.

saint.text: The time of our life is short; let us use it well for the glory of God.

12-31.question: As you enter a new year, what one habit will you leave behind to make more room for God?
